What are some important updates and considerations I should be aware of when using the Verus CLI or GUI wallet, including potential false positives from antivirus software and a critical security update?

When using the Verus CLI or GUI wallet, there are several important updates and considerations you should be aware of. 

**False Positives from Antivirus Software:**
Some antivirus software, such as Avast and Kaspersky, may flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program). These warnings are not because the software is malicious, but because it is mining software that could potentially be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. You can learn more about these false positives from resources such as Malwarebytes and Kaspersky.

**Critical Security Update:**
A critical security update was incorporated into Version 0.5.9 of the Verus wallet, which fixes a Zcash protocol issue. It is highly recommended that all users upgrade to this version or a more recent one immediately, and discontinue use of previous wallets.

**Testnet Reset:**
The testnet was deleted and relaunched with the 0.5.9 release. If you have previously launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to 0.5.9, you will need to delete certain directories before running the new update. The directories to delete vary depending on your operating system:

* On Linux: `~/.komodo/VRSCTEST` and `~/.verustest`
* On MacOS: `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/VRSCTEST` and `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩⁨/VerusTest`
* On Windows: `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST` and `"%APPDATA%"\VerusTest`

By being aware of these updates and considerations, you can ensure the secure and proper use of your Verus wallet.

**MacOS:**
https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/23ae5a14f89a0806f1a6ac143c01a2a46bc3ddbe39136534444824e02b94329c/detection
**Linux-AMD64:** https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/82bf9054feaf39e750a98542086bf5e5217ce18200bd8ff40e509bbb4db00ac3/detection
**Windows:**
https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/e18d521cf928025dc935a6b280909cd4aaf06ed77fb60a0af5f43f92ddeb2805/detectionAvast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC.
To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources:
https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/
https://www.kaspersky.com/blog/not-a-virus/18015/
# IMPORTANT SECURITY/PRIVACY UPDATE
[Version 0.5.9](https://github.com/VerusCoin/VerusCoin/releases/tag/v0.5.9) incorporated a fix for the Zcash protocol issue described in: https://z.cash/support/security/announcements/security-announcement-2019-09-24/Updating to v0.5.9 or more recent version is considered CRITICAL, not mandatory. We recommended that all users upgrade to this version of the Verus CLI or GUI wallet immediately and discontinue use of previous wallets.# Notable Changes
- Fixed address parsing in getrawtransaction# Testnet Reset
The testnet was deleted and relaunched on the 0.5.9 release. **IF YOU HAVE LAST LAUNCHED VRSCTEST FROM A VERSION PRIOR TO 0.5.9, PLEASE DELETE THE FOLLOWING DIRECTORIES BEFORE RUNNING THIS NEW UPDATE:**
**Linux:**
```
~/.komodo/VRSCTEST
~/.verustest
```**MacOS**
```
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/VRSCTEST
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩⁨/VerusTest
```**Windows**
```
"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST
"%APPDATA%"\VerusTest
```
